Reason: The 'trickle_fsync' configuration option is performance-sensitive. The configuration directly impacts system performance by determining whether to fsync() at intervals during sequential writing to manage dirty buffers. This operation can have notable performance variations at the system level, especially on SSDs, as it helps avoid sudden dirty buffer flushing impacting read latencies. The code context also includes operations like creating compressed or checksummed sequential writers, which are time-expensive and memory-expensive, further indicating the performance sensitivity of the configuration.
